title: Australian Open live stream 2021: how to watch Grand Slam tennis online anywhere
author: james-laird
summary: Djokovic has a place in the Men's Final, but who will he face?
article: Professional tennis is back in earnest this February, as the world's top players including Novak Djokovic, Rafael Nadal, Serena Williams and Naomi Osaka took to the courts of Melbourne for the 2021 Australian Open. The first Grand Slam event of the new season, it's now in the final few matches of the tournament - so read on as we explain how to watch an Australian Open live stream and catch all the tennis online wherever you are right now.

Last year's Men's Singles champion, Djokovic, is favorite to repeat as champion in what would be a second Aussie Open three-peat for the Serbian. But he can't take anything for granted as he looks to add to his Grand Slam tally.

The sport's next generation of stars - namely semi-finalists Daniil Medvedev and Rafael Nadal's conqueror Stefanos Tsitsipas - have a golden opportunity in 2021 to establish a new pecking order as legends like Roger Federer remain sidelined due to injury.

Over in the Women's Singles draw, things are arguably even more competitive. The legendary Serena Williams has been denied a record-equalling 24th Grand Slam singles title again, leaving the court lost for words and in tears follow her error-ridden defeat to Japan's Naomi Osaka in the semi-finals, who will face another American, heavy underdog Jennifer Brady, is Saturday's final.

With so much at stake, the 2021 Australian Open is a tournament no tennis should miss - and no one has to. Just follow our guide below as we explain how to watch an Australian Open live stream and catch all the action online wherever you are right now.

For broadcast and streaming details in tennis-mad countries like the UK, Australia, US, Canada and New Zealand, just scroll down the page - everything you need to know is there, including details of who is showing the tennis.

But if you try to watch your domestic coverage from somewhere outside your home country, you'll soon find a problem - geo-blocking. That's where the broadcaster prevents you from watching your usual feed from abroad. It's a common problem for sports fans all over the world. Fortunately, there's an easy solution.

Novak Djokovic currently stands as the most successful men’s player at Melbourne Park, having won the Aussie Open on eight occasions (2008, 2011, 2012, 2013, 2015, 2016, 2019, 2020) – that’s twice more than Swiss rival Roger Federer.
Serena Williams leads the pack for women’s titles during the Open era, having been crowned champion on seven occasions (2003, 2005, 2007, 2009, 2010, 2015, 2017).
There’s a prize pot of AUD $71.5m up for grabs in Melbourne this year. The full breakdown hasn't yet been revealed, but both the men’s and women’s winners pocketed a tidy AUD $4,120,000 in 2020.
As with all Open tournaments, men’s matches are the best-of-five sets, while women’s and doubles matches are best-of-three.
The Australian Open is played at Melbourne Park in Melbourne, which is located in the Melbourne Sports and Entertainment Precinct; the event moved to this site in 1988.
